channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump's National Guard deployments face courtroom tests
item.description: High-stakes legal arguments over President Trump's effort to deploy National Guard troops in Portland, Oregon and Chicago played out at the same time in two federal courthouses Thursday.
item.content:encoded: High-stakes legal arguments over President Trump's effort to deploy National Guard troops in Portland, Oregon and Chicago played out at the same time in two federal courthouses Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Why health care for pets has been surging
item.description: The cost of health care for pets has been surging. It has almost doubled over the past five years. What is behind these rising costs?
item.content:encoded: The cost of health care for pets has been surging. It has almost doubled over the past five years. What is behind these rising costs?
item.dc:creator: Adrian Ma

item.title: She once was in prison. Now this Chicago mom helps others break the cycle of violence
item.description: Meet a previously incarcerated mother who works with young people to prevent gun violence in Chicago, one of several American cities where the homicide rate has significantly dropped in recent years.
item.content:encoded: Meet a previously incarcerated mother who works with young people to prevent gun violence in Chicago, one of several American cities where the homicide rate has significantly dropped in recent years.
item.dc:creator: Anna Savchenko

item.title: Letitia James, who prosecuted Trump in N.Y., is indicted on one count of bank fraud
item.description: The Attorney General in New York has been indicted on a bank fraud charge after President Trump urged the Justice Department to prosecute her.
item.content:encoded: The Attorney General in New York has been indicted on a bank fraud charge after President Trump urged the Justice Department to prosecute her.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Grand Canyon food pantry gears up to assist park employees who are missing paychecks
item.description: A food pantry inside Grand Canyon National Park is gearing up to again assist park employees missing paychecks due to the federal government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: A food pantry inside Grand Canyon National Park is gearing up to again assist park employees missing paychecks due to the federal government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Skabelund

item.title: Doctors Without Borders official in Gaza speaks ahead of possible ceasefire
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Jacob Granger, emergency coordinator in Gaza for Doctors Without Borders, about the current humanitarian situation in Gaza amid news of a ceasefire agreement.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Jacob Granger, emergency coordinator in Gaza for Doctors Without Borders, about the current humanitarian situation in Gaza amid news of a ceasefire agreement.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Hope and skepticism in Israel and Gaza
item.description: A reporter reflects on two years and two days of war, and the mixed feelings of hope and skepticism now in Israel and Gaza.
item.content:encoded: A reporter reflects on two years and two days of war, and the mixed feelings of hope and skepticism now in Israel and Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: 5 new albums debut in this week's Billboard top 10
item.description: NPR Music's Stephen Thompson reports on a handful of newcomers to the pop charts.
item.content:encoded: NPR Music's Stephen Thompson reports on a handful of newcomers to the pop charts.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: Nobel Committee honors László Krasznahorkai for work that 'reaffirms the power of art'
item.description: The newest Nobel literature laureate is a Hungarian novelist and screenwriter who has been called "a master of the apocalypse."
item.content:encoded: The newest Nobel literature laureate is a Hungarian novelist and screenwriter who has been called "a master of the apocalypse."
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Brené Brown says she tries to find the face of God in everyone she sees
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Brené Brown talks about trying to find the face of God in everyone she sees.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Brené Brown talks about trying to find the face of God in everyone she sees.
